channel.title: Level Design, Skinning and Modelling
channel.description: Chat about level creation of maps, models and skins using the Runtime.

item.title: 3DS Max 2010 Tutorials .
item.author: invalid@example.com (TurdDrive)
item.dc:creator: TurdDrive
item.content:encoded:
I have now got 3DS max for my computer and I would like to learn how to use it skilfully,

I've had a look around and i cant seem to find any extreme beginners tutorials for max.

Any direction towards good tutorials is thanked.

item.title: Color Palettes in Photoshop CS4 Help
item.author: invalid@example.com (Rajada)
item.dc:creator: Rajada
item.content:encoded:
I just recently learned that the light type setting 'color palette loop' uses the indexed colors of a specified pcx texture entered into the light's skin field. The default palettes (mostly in GenFX.utx) work great, however, it doesn't seem like I can actually create new ones from scratch, as the indexed colors need to be in the same order as the gradient.

Photoshop CS4 doesn't seem to have this option in the indexed color modes, and I'm not too keen on clicking and defining 256 (you have...

Color Palettes in Photoshop CS4 Help

item.title: Help needed for multiple floor elevator
item.author: invalid@example.com (ironvil)
item.dc:creator: ironvil
item.content:encoded: I need an elevator for more than 5 floors that will stop at each floor if you approach the door or click a button if easier to do. The it will travel up one floor at a time pausing for 2 secs on each floor. I need this otherwise my star destroyer is going to take 20 mins to get up to the bridge from the main deck Please help Ironvil. Should I post on Scripting page as well

item.title: Questions about UnrealEd 3.0 SOUNDS/MUSIC
item.author: invalid@example.com (darkwolfe75)
item.dc:creator: darkwolfe75
item.content:encoded:
Hello all! I am new to Unreal and the Unreal Editor world, but I'm picking things right up (I have worked with Photoshop, Flash, video editing, audio production, etc. so I have a bit of technical knowledge and general computing skills that allow me to learn quickly)

What I'd like to know is, can anyone point me towards resources on how to learn about UnrealEd 3.0/Unreal Engine 2 SOUNDS and MUSIC??!! There is a shocking lack of tutorials and info available on the aural dimensions of the...

Questions about UnrealEd 3.0 SOUNDS/MUSIC

item.title: WIP - Industrial Yard
item.author: invalid@example.com (mjl86)
item.dc:creator: mjl86
item.content:encoded:
This map uses 95% custom content, created in Max, Photoshop, SpeedTree, and UDK - build time ~2 1/2 weeks

It's an industrial property located across a river in a city. Plenty of buildings and vertical action, with open space for Scorpion vehicles too

...

WIP - Industrial Yard

item.title: StaticMeshActor Skins & Texturing issues
item.author: invalid@example.com (Zerreth)
item.dc:creator: Zerreth
item.content:encoded:
Hi, i'm very new to the whole unreal editing concept as i'm used to source engine mapping. After reading a lot of wiki pages I still can't figure some things out.

(http://wiki.beyondunreal.com/Legacy:StaticMeshActor)
Currently I have no clue how to add multiple materials to 1 model, and how to switch between skins.

What should be skin00


What should be skin01...

StaticMeshActor Skins & Texturing issues

item.title: Need Meshes
item.author: invalid@example.com (Rykin)
item.dc:creator: Rykin
item.content:encoded:
I am in a level design class using UE2RT and I have been looking for some static meshes to use in my level design. I just need some basic modern office type stuff (desks, chairs, shelves, vending machines, coffee cups, etc) but I am having zero luck finding anything for Unreal besides space themed stuff.

Just wondering if someone out there can point me to somewhere that has free models/meshes I could use to help me finish up the design of my level? Is it possible to convert SketchUp...

Need Meshes

item.title: Cropping Materials in UnrealED3
item.author: invalid@example.com (YakZSmelk)
item.dc:creator: YakZSmelk
item.content:encoded:
I created an environment in 3ds max and some of the objects I used share texture sheets. I'm wondering how I can crop a texture sheet within Unreal so I can use a specific area of the texture to tile in the environment.

BTW I have a strict number of texture sheets I can use so I cannot just make a new one.

item.title: i want to make a FPS with Unreal Engine2
item.author: invalid@example.com (Black_Raven546)
item.dc:creator: Black_Raven546
item.content:encoded:
id use 3 but it dosent play on low XD (and i dont think its open yet) and i can run 2 on FULL .
ive noticed the Unreal 2 Engine is pretty lame it just has all the tools to start making stuff.
so where would i start if i wanted to make a FPS game?

also i use 3d software so where can i find to to import my 3d stuff into unreal ED.
(i use cinema 4D/ maya "prefer C4D plugins")

item.title: unreal runtime editor problem
item.author: invalid@example.com (mag7spy)
item.dc:creator: mag7spy
item.content:encoded:
I have this book that teachers u everything about this engine( http://www.informit.com/store/product.aspx?isbn=0672326922 )

It has tutorial files on it i cant acesess them because it says:

You cannot use content created in the commercial version of the UnrealEngine2 Runtime with the free version. Please remove the commercial version content from your Runtime.

So what the hell is the point of buying the book if i cant use any of the textures or static meshes while im...

unreal runtime editor problem

item.title: Kismet Triggering
item.author: invalid@example.com (iwilliams)
item.dc:creator: iwilliams
item.content:encoded:
I am designing a mazed theme level. Currently the level is a death match. What I would like to do is once a person touches a trigger that person will win the match. How do I make the person the winner of the match once they have touched the trigger located at the end of the maze?

Thanks, Isaiah

item.title: Light Color (lighting problem)
item.author: invalid@example.com (gamergirl1337)
item.dc:creator: gamergirl1337
item.content:encoded: I'm making a labrynth and I am adding light to it. I'm adding a red lighting for dead ends. and the rest is just regular lighting. Anyways, I will change the "light Color" to a dark redish color, and when I go back to adjust that color when I click the "color" button a critical error shows up (theres a pic below) is there a way to fix this. It has never happened before.

item.title: Noob * How to Rotate stairs

item.title: Which is better to start learning Unreal 2 Runtime or UnrealEd 3?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mariol)
item.dc:creator: Mariol
item.content:encoded: I'm just starting to learn how to build levels with UnrealEd. I've got a copy of UnrealEd Runtime 2 but I was wondering is there any vast difference between that and UnrealEd 3? Should I learn with 2 because it'll be easier to learn with and then move to 3 or shall I just start with 3?

item.title: needed: new Weapon from scrach tutorial
item.author: invalid@example.com (CiberX15)
item.dc:creator: CiberX15
item.content:encoded:
Ok I am using the UnrealEngine2 runtime (duh). I am trying to make a weapon and the tutorials I have looked at have all been for the unreal games. The UnrealEngine2 runtime doesn’t come with pre built weapons I could use as an example so could anyone direct me to a tutorial specifically for UnrealEngine2 runtime. I basically have a blank slate and I want to create my own stand alone game using Unreal.

My major problem at the moment it that my weapon won’t display in game. I have created a...

needed: new Weapon from scrach tutorial

item.title: Imported skeletal animation performing worse than native vertexanim
item.author: invalid@example.com (gedassan)
item.dc:creator: gedassan
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

Here is some pre-history if interested. If not, please look at section "Question".
I have imported my custom made bee from 3dsmax to UT2004 and set it as a model my custom NPC (pawn). I scripted all my behavior using the NaliCow vertexmesh with default animations. Later I simply exchanged it for the custom model.

The model animates well. However, it moves differently, and does not perform some of the scripted actions that the native model performed well.

I have a theory that...

Imported skeletal animation performing worse than native vertexanim

item.title: SkeletalMesh and AnimationMesh
item.author: invalid@example.com (Teoma)
item.dc:creator: Teoma
item.content:encoded: Hi, i have a Question about SkeletalMesh and AnimationMesh, its possible to open AnimationMesh In UnrealEngineRuntime .And how to export SkeletalMesh from ukx .I heard that is a Patch for UnrealEngineRuntime which allows to import Ukx in UnrealEngineRuntime.If who knows something write here
